timeline.bodyText: Is there a reason why we went with EPDX as a prefix here and we use pdex as a suffix and package name in other places? Should this be PDEXResourceProvider?
timeline.author: JohnTimm
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,16 @@
+/*
+ * (C) Copyright IBM Corp. 2020
+ *
+ * SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0
+ */
+
+package com.ibm.fhir.ig.davinci.pdex;
+
+import com.ibm.fhir.registry.util.PackageRegistryResourceProvider;
+
+public class EPDXResourceProvider extends PackageRegistryResourceProvider {

replies.bodyText: I've updated the class name to use PDEX (it's very confusing on their site).
replies.author: prb112

replies.bodyText:
I agree its confusing.  My "best guess" is that originally they used epdx and so thats what is in the repo and the path of the IG on the build site.
However, all the canonical URLs in the IG use pdex and not epdx and I think that signals that this will be published at http://hl7.org/fhir/us/davinci-pdex (rather than http://hl7.org/fhir/us/davinci-epdx)...therefor I'm thinking that we should use pdex everywhere and squash all usage of epdx (include the module name).
replies.author: lmsurpre

timeline.bodyText: did we open a JIRA issue for this one?
timeline.author: lmsurpre
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,7 @@
+Version 1
+- Changed the precision of json/profiles/fhir-ig-davinci-epdx/Patient-1.json's 
+Text '2020-07-07T13:26:22.0314215+00:00' could not be parsed at index 26 [Patient.meta.lastUpdated] 
+
+- Modified the expression for provenance-1
+From ($this.agent.who.resolve().is Practitioner or Device) implies exists()

replies.bodyText:
OK, I found it at https://jira.hl7.org/browse/FHIR-28451, recommend we include that here.

replies.bodyText: Was this accidentally omitted or you disagreed about adding a link to the issue?
replies.author: lmsurpre

replies.bodyText: No,  it's not intentional, I had tried adding it as a commit, and may have overwritten with the folder change
replies.author: prb112
